title: Reproducing Germany vs EU/EEA HAI Burden (BHAI)
text: can visualize relative severity infection type using DALYs per 100,000 population see Germany pattern align EU/EEA context. result show infection lower Germany HAP BSI, UTI CDI higher compared region.  within Germany, also know infection contributes total DALYs burden  HAP (pneumonia) UTI (urinary tract infection) make burden, together two thirds total. BSI (bloodstream infection) also adds another share, SSI CDI minor. Overall, Germany’s health loss HAIs comes lung, urinary, bloodstream infections.
code: library(tidyr) combined <- asg4::germany_burden |>   select(hai_type, dalys_per100k) |>   mutate(country = "Germany") |>   bind_rows(asg4::eu_eea_burden %>%               mutate(country = "EU/EEA"))  ggplot(combined, aes(x = hai_type, y = dalys_per100k, fill = country)) +   geom_col(position = "dodge") +   labs(     x = "Infection type",     y = "DALYs per 100,000",     title = "Comparison of Germany vs EU/EEA DALY burden (2011–2012)",     fill = "Region"   ) +   theme_minimal(base_size = 13) asg4::germany_burden |> mutate( share = dalys_per100k / sum(dalys_per100k), label = paste0(hai_type, " (", round(share * 100, 1), "%)") ) |> ggplot(aes(x = "", y = share, fill = hai_type)) + geom_col(width = 1, color = "white") + coord_polar(theta = "y") + geom_text(aes(label = paste0(round(share * 100, 1), "%")), position = position_stack(vjust = 0.5), size = 4) + labs( title = "Share of Total DALY Burden by Infection Type (Germany, 2011–2012)", fill = "Infection Type", y = NULL, x = NULL ) + scale_fill_brewer(palette = "Set3") + theme_void(base_size = 13)

Compared EU/EEA averages, Germany’s DALYs slightly lower pneumonia bloodstream infections higher urinary CDI. differences likely reflect variations healthcare settings, antibiotic resistance, use EU/EEA McCabe severity distributions Germany. Despite variations, ranking infection burden remains consistent, underscoring robustness BHAI methodology.
